pros: It’s amazing to learn and a level 1 trauma center. Pay benefits are great.
cons: The culture among nurses is one that is not healthy. They are rude to new grads roll their eyes. Make passive aggressive comments publicly. Providers as well. Your patients will be the nicest you experience. You will get locked into a year long contract if you sign a bonus or enter the new grad program. You will then have to stay an extra year or be forced to pay that money back. You will not see your family because you are a .7 or higher. You will not be home for holidays. You will not get approved for vacation in your first several years. If it’s starting to sound like an abusive relationship yet. That’s because it is.

review_title: Only Directors and above make money
pros: Most clinical staff are very devoted to their patients
cons: Management is 100% driven by cutting expenses period. There is a crushing inability to attract and retain talent and management's answer to is hire travel staff. Clearly travel staff must come from a separate budget or federal dollars. Higher management all work remote, they are never onsite, they seem completely fine watching talent walk out the door to competitors. They hang on by folks doing two jobs - till they are so burned out they leave - often without a new job. I have never worked anywhere where the C Suites are so entirely focused on one thing - cutting expenses - so they can present that to the board and retain their compensation. There seems to be no plan for how to staff tomorrow or stay afloat in the future with talent constantly leaving. To note - staff will often ask if NM or Blaze will match the salary they are leaving for and if so - they will stay. I have never seen NM or Blaze C Suites agreeing. Instead, they just say, "See ya"...

pros: Great leadership Pillar of the community Level I Trauma Center Diversity in patient population Competitive compensation Solid Benefits Opportunities to grow
cons: N/A They continue to elevate and adapt to demands

pros: Really great staff! Such a welcoming environment!
cons: Block schedules would be a plus!

review_title: Worst EMS company I have seen in my life
job_title: Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) in Robbinsdale, MN
pros: Absolutely nothing I would say is a pro about working for this company
cons: North memorial has hazing new hires attitude that is unprofessional, dangerous and put patients lives at risk. The Medical Direction is horrible and they won't justify the reasons why they have a strict protocols or won't let paramedics do interventions. They treat the EMT's like trash and BLS trucks aren't allowed to respond lights or sirens unless a paramedic is on board even if the hospital is closer. The work environment is very political, and they bring government political arguments against co-workers and especially new hires. The pay rate for EMTS and paramedics is the lowest around. Other companies pay way more!!. Stay away from this company!!

pros: Diverse employees and clientele. Opportunities to serve marginalized populations. Ridiculously understaffed - so good for ppl who want to pick up lots of shifts randomly.
cons: Older units in the hospital are so run down and neglected they are unsafe. In half the rooms on my unit you can’t even turn room lights on without using a flashlight to go in and dig the pt call button out of the bed and use the pt light controls. There is literally no HVAC in many of the rooms in my unit. The kitchen is 50/50 with delivering. I would never send a loved one to this hospital simply for the basic needs that go unmet in the facility. Also the double rooms are tiny. You can bet they don’t charge half price for half a room with half the quality of care. They also push pt assignments on the charges and guilt them by talking about the ED backups… terrible staffing policies. But that’s not a unique problem in hospitals.

review_title: Great place to work with awesome comradery!
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Maple Grove, MN
pros: Great work environment! Small hospital, so we know everyone well. Doctors are so approachable and kind. Awesome comradery! Everyone is super helpful and wants you to succeed. The manager and assistant managers are very down-to-earth and approachable. Nurse travelers had assignments here and took permanent jobs on the unit. $3000 for tuition reimbursement annually.
cons: Rn to staff ratios are 1:4-5 during the day; 5 patients can make the day super busy. A lot of patient turnover due to 1-day stay surgeries. Scheduling issues can occur but it's not terrible.

Experience is threatening to the stupid and its really sad.

pros: I always felt like my managers had my back, even though manager turnover rate was quite high. I learned a lot as a new grad nurse and was able to learn from some really wonderful experienced nurses. The pay and benefits are also very good. If you work straight night shift, you get a $4 differential and extra PTO time-aka "night shift bonus". You also get free parking if you are straight nights. Even if you do have to pay for parking, it's very reasonable. I believe that North Memorial staff are always prepared when a patient declines quickly. Whenever I had to call a rapid response, people were always there to help immediately.
cons: I just felt so stuck at North Memorial. This was my first nursing job, and while I learned a lot, the area that I was hired into was not the area that I desired to work in. I felt miserable and had so much anxiety going into work each day. During the hours leading up to each shift, I would pray and pray that staffing would call and offer LOA or on call. I would sit in my car before my shift and feel physically ill because of the anxiety. I continuously expressed interest in switching to a different specialty, but was repeatedly given excuses as to why I wouldn't be able to. I felt that my advancement as a nurse was not supported because of this. I now am working in labor and delivery at a different hospital and my mental health has improved drastically. I no longer dread going to work :)

pros: Great people, positive attitudes, and appreciative leaders.
cons: Sometimes projects get bogged down or too many cooks can get in the kitchen, but that isn't a problem that is necessarily unique to North.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Maple Grove, MN
pros:
Working with patients
Helping people

Working with patients every day, helping people, and making a difference are all crucial parts of working in a hospital setting. There is nothing better than seeing a new life brought into the world, or making a person feel better and knowing you made a difference. This is the only thing that has kept me, personally, here this long.
cons:
High school-like environment
Nosy employees
Cliques
Lazy co-workers
Management only cares about money - not patients or employees

The pros do not put the cons off balance. The other staff are... negligent in a lot of ways. Many will go out of their way to not have to do something. Favoritism is a major problem. Employees that have been here the longest immediately have this superpower to be able to get away with anything. This is to the extreme point of even spying on other coworkers, taking pictures of them and sharing them with management, or talking about people while their back is turned. It's like high school all over again. The patient care is insufficient, and that is a kind description. Most of the time the most basic of duties are upheld, and then the staff rushes off to a corner to either gossip about patients or other coworkers. They are hostile toward newcomers, or anyone that happens to notice their flaws and try to put them in their place. They will try to get you removed just for doing your job the way it should be done, they're threatened by the fact that you actually do your job.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Robbinsdale, MN
pros: Pay and hours are what is best from the company
cons: No advancement in direct departments

pros: Great surgeons, great variety of cases, robot surgery with highly skilled surgeons
cons: Managed so poorly they have lost and rotated staff, at a maximum under previous management travelers were few, now due to really terrible management they can't maintain a core staff and rely on travelers to do the heavy lifting. Throughout the hospital management is unresponsive to needs. Short staffing is the norm. None of this is surprising however when you have totally inexperienced people trying to manage a relatively busy level 1 trauma center. It's sad, north used to be a great place to work both as a traveler or employee, it's now a keep your head down, shut up, and be happy you have a job. I'd only recommend working here if your a strong personality who likes chaos.

pros: Great patients and co-workers nice buildings
cons:

cons: Nursing shortages everywhere. No breaks.

pros: Great team, Great patients,Flexible staffing

pros: Union benefits, training and orientation were solid.
cons: Acuity of patients very high. Not a lot of support from management.

pros: I loved my immediate Supervisor, was very knowledgeable of the RCM, Compliance area within Billing, Coding and Documentation requirements. Would jump at an opportunity to work with this individual again.
cons:
No Cheif Medical Officer, how do you direct a hospital without the role.
 The entire RCM Department from Director of RCM, Director of Compliance, Billing Mgr resigned. All due to complete lack of support from Upper leadership. No one seems to understand the complexity of Revenue Cycle Management or Compliance for Billing, Coding, Documenation Coding Guidelines per Medicare Guidelines. Bringing in a consulting company to determine what is needed, when from an outsider looking in was blatanly obvious. Wastefullness of resources when the organization is having money issues. Upperleadership clearly does NOT support management. Truly shameful as they have lost some very skilled, and talented staff.

pros: Coworkers made this place like home. The patients loved how quiet everything seemed even if it was busy, order-when-ready approach great for patients, and the scenery... I've worked at 5 hospitals and this is the first to have a corn field and swamp as scenery vs. other buildings, provides a calming effect
cons: Not enough staff, upper management seems to care solely about numbers

review_title: Supportive Leaders Make All the Difference
pros:
It has been my experience that the leaders I work with are approachable and respectful. Leadership seems to understand that employees have home lives/family and promote work/life balance. Most of my co-workers form a supportive team, lending a helping hand whenever asked. 
North Memorial challenges employees with the unique task of providing unmatched customer service to all customers (patients and their families). This makes up a culturally diverse pool of people with a variety of needs and preferences. The urban/suburban location perfectly supports this diversity.
cons: Busy, fast-paced, and sometimes overwhelming workload on some floors. I frequently have worked through my lunch break AND stayed late in order to try to complete required tasks while maintaining the provision of unmatched customer service.

pros: North Memorial's mission of providing compassionate, remarkable care to our patients has been evident to me in all interactions I've had with others who work here.  Everyone is very helpful, friendly, and goes above and beyond to ensure our patients receive excellent care.  The benefits package is much better than my previous job.  They offer 4% matching on their 401(k) plan, affordable medical and dental plans, and after working here for 1 year they start contributing to a pension for full-time employees which is very rare these days.  Overall, I'm very happy I made the decision to work for this company.
cons: You won't always receive a lot of direction, so you need to be self-motivated and take initiative.  I don't consider it a con, but some people don't do well in that type of environment.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Prior Lake, MN
pros: Excellent opportunities for learning and educating yourself if you're the type of nurse that takes advantage of all the diversity and complex medical issues that you are surrounded with regardless of where you work in this hospital.  Generally, employees are pleasant and kind to each other.
cons: Opportunities for growth (for example: training for ICU) are VERY competitive and based on seniority.  The wait list for working in an ICU is 3-4 years.  There is occasionally some racial tension, especially if there are misunderstandings between RN's and CNA's making communication and working relationships awkward.  Management has a hard time with knowing how to deal with these issues and often chooses not to get involved at all because they are afraid of racial attacks coming back to them.

review_title: Worst working environment I have ever encountered
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Maple Grove, MN
pros: Patients think it is nice.
cons: People here are cruel to newcomers. Management is inept, unsupportive, and really have no clue what they are doing.  There was gossip, lies, backstabbing.  All this was not only tolerated by management but encouraged.  I was not taught what was expected or helped/supported in my job.  If the current clique doesn't want you there, they will resort to whatever cruelty necessary to get you to leave or get management, who seem all too happy to, to harass and degrade you.  Why this is tolerated is beyond me.  I believe they have probably lost many excellent employees and there is little hope for this type of organization.

review_title: Not a place to feel good about what you do
pros: Early on North was a great place to work.  They allowed you the autonomy to excel!
cons: Controlling, management is too competitive to produce any flow.  Problems never get resolved as they are too paranoid to share info between departments, there for nothing ever gets resolved.  The employee then gets blamed for not getting things done as you wait for answers from up high that never come.

review_title: Great entry level position, good benefits, union based, and decent pay
pros:
For those that are seeking experience great place to start and flexible with hours. Most of staff if generally friendly and willing to help with questions. 

Seniority also aids those who have been with the company for a period of time as they have first preference based on hours worked
cons:
If you do not contract a full time position hours can be difficult to obtain, salary is increased based on how many hours applied; meaning that in order to gain an increase in pay you must put a full years worth of hours. 

Seniority can influence hours obtained if you are first starting out as preference will be given

pros: Nice surroundings, some staff are nice
cons: Horrible management, never experienced anything like it.  Toxic micromanagement, relentless nit picking, lying and blaming new staff.  Direction was arbitrary.  So many people were involved wanting things done their way thus the "right" way, it was confusing and bizarre.  The micromanagement and cruelty increased and became abusive.  All sight of what should have been our priority, customer experience, was overlooked and lost.  Attempts to point this out, or even speak or be listened to were completely impossible.  I have NEVER seen anything like it and I have worked happily and successfully in several health care facilities.

pros: Coworkers are competent kind and very caring. Lots of time to learn how to do job, compensation OK, benefits are good
cons: Due to not having enough staff or the resources it needs to really thrive its discouraging. implementation of change is frustarting for everyone. Seems to wait and see instead of being proactive and wanting to put a great service out there. Disorganized due to everyone being maxed out

review_title: Worst place I have ever worked
pros: The building and grounds are beautiful. The trail around the hospital is nice for walks. Everything is nice and new. The patients are very gracious and understanding.
cons: The management is the worst leadership of any place I have ever worked in my career. There is no such thing as HIPPA at this facility and staff has no problem gossiping about the patients and co-workers. Instead of admitting there are issues on a management level they outwardly accuse their employees of embellishing or outwardly lying. They expect employees to sacrifice personal time to help them and use intimidation to make it happen.

job_title: Medical Assistant in Maple Grove, MN
pros: Benefits, and the patients. Unfortunately this clinic has the potential to be a perfect place to work. Management has been the same for 20 years so, I'm not sure the problems will ever change.
cons: Worst management I've ever had. A lot of turn over due to management. If you're friends with management you do not have to perform your job. Very cliquey. Management does not value their hard working employees. Not all employees are held to the same standard.

pros: Pay MAN Hospital, Treat new young employees well . Treat new young cheaper employees well.
cons: Treat long term employees poorly. Very click and need to be drinking buddies with the boss to do well. They actually Harass the older employees to push them out. They are always pushing the staffing to get more for less. It is almost to the extreme of being unsafe on the intermediate cardiac/ respiratory unit. Lots of turn over. We lost 40 Nurses and Nursing assistance on a 20 bed unit in less then 1 year.

pros:
- Trust from leadership
- Collaboration within team/department
- Benefits (great PTO, 401K match, FSA for childcare, HSA, tuition reimbursement)
- Leadership is willing to listen
- Wonderful people to work with; genuine employees wanting to make a difference
- Work/life balance
- Dept manager and director
cons:
- Marketing department leadership
- Wellness reimbursement decrease and other benefit changes
- Money spent on new logo/marketing but no return on investment
- Leadership not seeing the value in community partnerships
- "Customer service" training not well executed; did not translate to work; very theory-based
- No growth opportunities

pros: Very bad senior leaders in the past have been replaced by decent leaders. Very friendly co-workers so you do become friends with lots of people. Maple Grove is a nice place to work, Robbinsdale not so much.
cons: The company is always broke, year after year and the layoffs  keep going on.  It just sucks the morale from the employees. Hard being in a company that is always in cutting mode. Benefits are also poor.

pros: The pay is alright and the new Pharmacy Director is making a lot of improvements. Excited about the renovation.
cons:
Union

Pharmacy specific....training, seniority (the seniors complain too much), they can't accommodate your schedule because the seniors goes to the union about everything, frequent change in management, high turn over rate, I was promised 1 evening per pay period and the rest days when I was offered the position and hired....but that fell through after my 90 days, inconsistent schedule, and the schedule is always coming out late.

pros: On site fitness center with classes, employee resource center that offers fun activities and discounts throughout the year. Nice facility and many nice people. They have a full benefits package.
cons: I work in an office with a micro manager. I'm sure there are other departments that are better. You do have to pay to park in the ramp that is close to the hospital but they offer a free lot, down the street.

job_title: A Concerned Employee in Robbinsdale, MN
pros: Good employees. Individuals that want to do the right things for patients. Allot of untapped talent do to leadership style allowed to continue. If employees would be given the opportunity and advancement the organization could really benefit.
cons: The organization is full of narcissist leaders that can not be trusted. They will try to be your best friend until they are not. Good leaders and employees are not calling out this behavior do to retaliation and intimidation concerns.  There are some discrimination concerns unreported.

review_title: This is an excellent company to work for.
pros: Great benefits. Good wages and very nice pay raise. This company is very concerned with the care of patients and even rewards employees who take good care of people.
cons: I really found the processes I of bidding on shifts stressful as new people who bid last have no idea if they will be working days, nights, overnights or even a combination within the same week.  It wouldn't be so bad but you rebid every six months.

review_title: A small metro hospital going through some growing pains in order to stay competitive.
pros: Smaller environment with good opportunities for advancement.
cons: Organizational communications and priorities either don’t make it down to the individual level or leadership isn’t promoting the plans and goals for the company effectively.

pros: I can offer your company a strong, dependable work ethic. Plus, I have outstanding organizational and coordination skills.  I can build strong bonds with others and enjoy working as part of  a team.
cons: I know I needs to constantly work on time management.  From time to time my confidence waivers.  Sometimes my work life balance gets kilter.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Maple Grove, MN
pros: Working for Maple Grove Hospital allows you to help people who need help. This is very rewarding. I love helping people all the time.
cons: Sometime the people you help aren't very nice. It takes all  of my energy to stay positive. However, I remember why I'm there and I make it work.

review_title: Great place to work, wish there were more resources when needed
pros: They allow you to expand your experience by cross training. There is variety and people I work day to day with are GREAT! It one of the reasons I stay.
cons: Not enough resources (people and money) to get projects completed. It's good to have a job but burn out rate is high!

review_title: Lots of room for growth, great place to work
job_title: Help Desk Analyst in Robbinsdale, MN
pros:
The employee health center, imagine a clinic, you don't pay co-pays at for employees.
The fitness center, they have one, it's a pretty good deal.
cons: They removed the employee reimbursement program for non-union staff while I worked there.  While working there it was hard to see people owning issues and working together to get things fixed.

job_title: Human Resources Coordinator in Robbinsdale, MN
pros: Able to use my great customer service skills to help individuals and employees  find a great fit for their career. Excellent team playing skills. Great partnerships.
cons: Operated very lean.  Wore many hats and back-up to our front desk.  Took away from my daily tasks at hand.

pros: Great company to work for. I have worked at both the hospital and at our clinics.
cons: Some of the units are very clicky and are difficult to work in due to personality conflicts.

pros: high energy team with a great vision for the future. A great place to work.
cons: A bit disorganized, so be comfortable with chaos and be able to adapt and change your project focus as needed. Could use a little more collaboration.

pros: Nice People, higher wages, fast paced, on job training, allowed to work in all areas, good relationship with pharmacists, remodeled pharmacy area
cons: unfriendly management, electronic systems that don't work properly, poorly staffed, no coverage for sick calls, inflexible work schedules, poor communication between pharmacy and other hospital departments

job_title: Safety & Security Officer in Robbinsdale, MN
pros: Great group of officers and staff to work with and for. I enjoy dealing with the wide range of ethnic backgrounds of all our customers, guest and team members.
cons: Pay is lower then what it should be for our department for everything we deal with and do for the hospital, but there are lower gigs out there.

review_title: A great place to begin my career
pros: North Memorial has given me great opportunities to broaden my nursing career.  The managers have made me feel like I'm integral to the team.
cons: With the restructuring of the hospital to "increase profitability," many nurses had to change positions within the hospital.  While it wound up being a nice change many were upset that they were forced to leave their old units.

job_title: Office Employee III in Brooklyn Center, MN
pros: Union job so pay is above average, work at home one day per week
cons: Extremely negative environment - Management is conservative/behind in the times; they are not open to new ideas or any change.  Heavy work load. Employees are expected to not talk to each other at all, 3 supervisors per employee with 'rounding' or being written up every 3-4weeks

job_title: IT Applications Administrator II in Robbinsdale, MN
pros: The people were great.  Benefits were pretty good.
cons: My manager was horrible and never took time to get to know me or develop me.  She never worked with anybody but spent her time in her office with paperwork.  Management very very hands off and never took time to get to know the people that worked in the department.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Maple Grove, MN
pros: Great co-workers! Free parking. 12 and 8 hour shifts. No mandatory overtime. Clean. Patients love the hospital. Overall, great physicians to work with.
cons: Supplies not always available.  Understaffed, especially on nights.  Management not always experienced in their area so therfore,  they were not able to jump in if needed. Slow computer connections.

pros: The on-site cafeteria had reasonable prices and different specials each day; parking in the open air lot was free and covered parking was a small charge each month. My salary was very generous for what I was doing.
cons: The organization never felt like it knew what it was doing; training for non-patient care staff was non-existent. The medical/dental benefits were not very good.

pros: Working in a clinical environment
cons: Management is can be improved. Not to be mean but they are a bunch of misfits. We had made huge progress in improving the staff's hours so people wouldn't work 7 or 8 days in a row. New management came in and destroyed all the progress. Now working 7 to 9 days in a row which only leads to burnout.

review_title: Provide quality patient care with fewer and fewer resources.
pros: co-workers, good training, flexible hours, reasonable pay, chance to see other departments, variety of experience, electronic documentation, opportunity for advancement
cons: Money seems to be the bottom line for management. flexible hours

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Robbinsdale, MN
pros:
Between the Union and the hospital you get several raises the first 5 years.
Lots of change for the better going on here.
Positive Environment.
cons:
Union keeps peoples jobs that shouldn't always be kept.
No maternity leave, have to use your own personal vacation time.
Scheduling every other  weekend.

pros: good ppl to work around great jobs to do, and not enough people to do them. but the people keep you interested.
cons: management is sometimes too relaxed, too many times the sups expect you to do their jobs, and too many chiefs not enough indiansq1

review_title: Company bought out by North Memorial
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Blaine, MN
pros: Good pay, good location, good physicians
cons: Lack of communication between departments/supervisors, etc. HR and Team member health are never around to take calls when you have an issue.

pros: Patient interaction, not always micro-managing, new campus in Maple Grove is exceptional (but also a partnership, not just Maple Grove).
cons: Supervisory staff is lackluster, the benefits have been slashed immensely over the years, the corporate culture is soul-less, the focus is on saving as much money as possible to the detriment of both patient and employee, the morale is horrible, and the food service is probably just one level above what they get in prison from the same food management company.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Maple Grove, MN
pros: nice facility, easy to get to, good parking, friendly staff and strong leadership.
cons: A lot of our direction comes from North Memorial...hard to have our own identity as a separate facility. Main focus our MGH seems to be babies...we do a lot more than that.

review_title: This employer was very inefficient. There were a lot of continuity issues.
pros: To be able to meet with new patients daily.
cons: Protocols were not enforced or followed.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Robbinsdale, MN
pros: Work double shifts and make time and a half.  Union.
cons: Working every other weekend.  Each unit has their cliques. Very strenuous work depending on what floor you're on. Nurses can be of no help.

job_title: Patient Registration Representative in Robbinsdale, MN
pros: Good low level management, great coworkers, teamwork atmosphere, fun place to work, fast paced
cons: Always short staffed, high turnover.

pros: They you want you to succeed and will work with you, relentlessly, until you achieve your goal(s)
cons: Like all organizations, they have to be focused on the "Bottom Line." This does not reflect on how they treat their employees, they care for their employees

review_title: Fast paced, challenging and professionally satisfying.
pros: Smart people, challenging work.  Never a dull moment and a very supportive and passionate leadership team.  Everyone in the organization is committed to the strategic goals and engaged in achieving success.
cons: Lack of resources, over-dependence on meetings and emails.

pros: Competitive pay, co-workers, laid-back hands off management

pros: Easy job, friendly environment to work
